title: Energy of SHM - calculate KE at position

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="0.25 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> is attached to a horizontal spring with spring constant <math alttext="100 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>. The block is displaced a distance <math alttext="0.020 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.020</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> from equilibrium and released from rest, undergoing simple harmonic motion. The kinetic energy of the block when it is <math alttext="0.010 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.010</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> from equilibrium is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="0 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.005 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.005</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.015 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.015</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.020 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.020</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.015 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.015</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
